areas.name: Reading Length Early
areas.description: Ability to judge the length early determines shot selection and reduces dismissal chances.

drills.name: Bounce Spot Recognition
how_to: Coach drops balls from shoulder height

drills.name: Visual Reaction Tape Drill
how_to: Pitch is marked with 3 coloured zones

areas.name: Line Reading & Off-Stump Awareness
areas.description: Knowing where your off stump is improves leave judgement and reduces edges.

drills.name: Off-Stump Stick Drill
how_to: Place an extra stump outside off stump
Batter must leave every ball outside stump

drills.name: Leave Decision Reaction Drill
how_to: Coach mixes balls on 5th stump channel

areas.name: Shot Selection Discipline
areas.description: Knowing when to attack, defend or leave increases batting consistency and innings building.

drills.name: Game Scenario Shot Filter
how_to: Batter selects correct shot for ball type

areas.name: Timing & Rhythm
areas.description: Ability to sync hand speed, body rotation, and ball arrival to produce clean contact.
why_it_matters: Builds flow and feel for batting

drills.name: Drop Feed Timing Drill
how_to: Partner holds ball above eye level
Focus on late contact under eyes

drills.name: Single-Hand Batting Drill
how_to: Hold bat with top hand only

areas.name: Hand–Eye Coordination
areas.description: Coordination between eye focus and hand movement improves precision and middle contact.

drills.name: Small Ball Batting
how_to: Use mini balls or table tennis balls
Batter plays soft shots inside a circle

areas.name: Playing the Ball Late
areas.description: Hitting the ball close to body improves control and reduces edges against seam and swing.

drills.name: Under-the-Eyes Batting Drill
how_to: Coach bowls slowly on off stump

drills.name: Half Bat Face Drill
how_to: Paint a thin line on bat face
Batter must strike using middle strip only

areas.name: Front-Foot Movement & Balance
areas.description: Ability to transfer weight forward with stability and head control, improving stroke quality to full length deliveries.
why_it_matters: Improves control against full/pitched up balls

drills.name: Front-Foot Press Drill
how_to: Stand in stance while coach calls 'press'
Press onto front foot with small stride
Play controlled soft drive without follow-through

drills.name: Front-Foot Drive Placeholder Drill
how_to: Place cones for ideal stride placement
Hit through cones with full face

areas.name: Back-Foot Movement & Balance
areas.description: Back-foot speed and stability allow batters to play short and back-of-length bowling with confidence.
why_it_matters: Improves shot control vs short balls
Enables effective cut and pull shots

drills.name: Back-Foot Press & Hit Drill
how_to: Player moves back quickly to hit tap shots

areas.name: Trigger Movement & Setup
areas.description: Controlled pre-delivery movement helps achieve stable positions for all shot types.

drills.name: Trigger Pattern Rehearsal
how_to: Mark ideal trigger position with tape
Shadow step to mark as ball is released

areas.name: Playing Swing & Seam (New Ball)
areas.description: Skill to adjust to late swing and seam movement against the new ball.

drills.name: Side-on Shadow Swing Drill
how_to: Focus on alignment and bat path

areas.name: Playing Short Ball Safely
areas.description: Teaches safe pull, sway, duck & control against short-pitched bowling.

areas.name: Playing High Pace on Bouncy Pitches
areas.description: Helps batters remain stable and confident against extra bounce & rapid pace.

drills.name: Tennis Bounce Feed Drill
how_to: Coach throws hard angled tennis balls

drills.name: Back Foot Punch on Bounce
how_to: Coach feeds balls rising chest high

areas.name: Playing Back-of-a-Length / Hard Length
areas.description: Improves judgement and technique versus difficult lengths that attack the top of off stump.

drills.name: Back Foot Defence Line Drill
how_to: Coach bowls on top of off stump
Player follows line with straight bat

areas.name: Front Foot Footwork to Spin
areas.description: Ability to use feet to reach the pitch of the ball and smother spin.

drills.name: Cone Footstep Path Drill
how_to: Step forward to cones and shadow defend

areas.name: Back Foot Play vs Spin (Using Crease Depth)
areas.description: Ability to use back foot depth to cut, pull, or defend against spin bounce.

drills.name: Crease Depth Shadow Drill
how_to: Batter moves from front to back crease line

drills.name: Back Foot Punch vs Spin
how_to: Coach bowls chest height spin balls
Player punches straight back past bowler

areas.name: Reading Spin (Air & Pitch)
areas.description: Skill to read turn direction, drift, dip, and seam rotation.

areas.name: Using Sweep Game (Normal, Slog, Reverse)
areas.description: Develops sweep variety for manipulating fielders and rotating strike.

drills.name: Power Slog Sweep Drill
how_to: Player slog sweeps to cow corner

areas.name: Strike Rotation – Drop & Run, Angle Manipulation
areas.description: Skill to find safe singles by dropping balls into gaps, manipulating angles, and keeping scoreboard moving.

drills.name: Angle Glide Drill
how_to: Must time into side angle cones

areas.name: Gap Finding & Field Placement Reading
areas.description: Ability to scan field placements and hit ball into open defensive gaps rather than fielders.

drills.name: Target Cone Placement Drill
how_to: Batter must hit into chosen cone lane

drills.name: Field Pattern Simulation
how_to: Player calls target zone before ball

areas.name: Soft Hands Technique – Controlling Edges & Nudges
areas.description: Technique to reduce edge carry by absorbing impact with controlled hands.
why_it_matters: Helps working singles through off side

drills.name: Bottom-Hand Loose Grip Drill
how_to: Hold bat lightly with bottom hand

drills.name: Nudge to Mid-wicket Drill
how_to: Player nudges into mid wicket cone
Focus on inside part of bat

drills.name: Slip Edge Drop Drill
how_to: Ball must die before wicket keeper

areas.name: Running Technique – Speed, Turn Efficiency, Acceleration
areas.description: Technical running form improves short distance acceleration, reduces fatigue, and maximises scoring opportunities.

drills.name: 20m Acceleration Sprint
how_to: Player sprints 20m from batting stance start

drills.name: Bat Carry Sprint Drill
how_to: Must run bat in right hand at first run

drills.name: Crease Turn Technique Drill
how_to: Player runs to crease, touches ground with bat

areas.name: Calling, Communication & Decision Making
areas.description: Communication prevents confusion, eliminates run outs, and builds batting partnerships.

drills.name: Blind Calling Simulation
how_to: Striker makes call based on contact
drills.safety: Walk first before running full pace

drills.name: Gap Awareness Running Drill
how_to: Player must choose single or no run

areas.name: Turning For Second Runs & Sliding/Diving Technique
areas.description: Efficient turning improves chance of doubles and prevents late run-out risks.
why_it_matters: Creates strike rotation under field spread

drills.name: Sliding Ground Entry
how_to: Player practices long reach bat slide

areas.name: Power-Hitting Sequencing Mechanics
areas.description: Efficient bat swing sequencing between lower body, trunk rotation and bat path improves maximum ball striking power.
why_it_matters: Improves bat speed without losing control

drills.name: Hip–Shoulder Separation Drill
how_to: Coach rotates hips first then shoulders

drills.name: Step-In Power Hitting
how_to: Hit ball straight or leg side

drills.name: Bottom-Hand Release
how_to: Hit 10 balls with loose top hand

areas.name: Range Hitting to All Zones
areas.description: Ability to hit to multiple boundary zones prevents predictability and increases death overs success.

drills.name: Inside-Out Loft Drill
how_to: Focus on extension and loft angle

drills.name: Reverse Power Switch
how_to: Use sweeps and slogs both sides

areas.name: Playing Yorkers & Low Full Tosses
areas.description: Mastery of yorker ball striking prevents bowled/ lbw dismissal at death overs.

drills.name: Scoop Block Progression
how_to: Progress to scoop once control established

areas.name: Playing Slow Balls & Variations
areas.description: Recognising slower balls avoids mistimed aerial shots in T20 death overs.

areas.name: Boundary-to-Boundary Intent
areas.description: Mental readiness to attack from ball one improves strike rate during powerplay and death overs.

drills.name: First Ball Intent Drill
how_to: First ball must be boundary attempt

areas.name: Field Awareness & Scoring Plan
areas.description: Ability to read field placements and build scoring plans reduces dot balls and increases strike rotation.

drills.name: Field Mapping Walkthrough
how_to: Player walks pitch visualizing scoring areas

drills.name: Scenario Scoring Simulation
how_to: Player picks scoring shot BEFORE bowler starts

areas.name: Pressure Batting & Mental Control
areas.description: Ability to remain calm under scoreboard pressure determines performance in run chases and finals.

drills.name: Pressure Zone Bowling
how_to: Player must chase with boundary focus

areas.name: Building an Innings
areas.description: Understanding early consolidation, strike rotation and acceleration patterns is key to long innings success.

drills.name: Dot Ball Reduction Drill
how_to: Player loses points for dot balls
